column4: ﻿Hello all, I have a problem with my IP tables. I installed a fiirewall which seemed to cause me problems so I removed it but it added a bunch of IP tables which everytime I reboot I have to clear my IP table rules, but they keep coming back! Help!

﻿Hello all, I have a problem with my IP tables. I installed a fiirewall which seemed to cause me problems so I removed it but it added a bunch of IP tables which everytime I reboot I have to clear my IP table rules, but they keep coming back! Help!

﻿Hello all, I have a problem with my IP tables. I installed a fiirewall which seemed to cause me problems so I removed it but it added a bunch of IP tables which everytime I reboot I have to clear my IP table rules, but they keep coming back! Help!
guarddog. I have to run the cmds list http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-iptables-how-to-flush-all-rules.html to get rid of the tables and allow traffic in and out but after a reboot they come back.
I did remove guarddog completely however.
did you try purging the package?
how do I do that? I normally add/remove through synapse
yeah, it's "completely remove" I believe instead of just "remove".  Is that what you did?
no I did completely but it did install a bunch of libraries needed to run on my system and maybe I missed a few of those?
cant I apt -get remove guarddog or something to get rid of it completely?
I don't think the libraries would matter.  aptitude purge guarddog
looks like I missed a peice of the firewall. A complete removal worked. Thanks.
I have some questions about Ubuntu IPtables. How knowledgable are you of iptables and firewalls?
I don't know much more than what is on that wiki page.  just ask the channel and I'll help if I can
